metadata.titel_preek: Fifth Sunday After the Epiphany / Baptism of the Lord

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God interrupts human mundane activity and sinfulness to impose a new reality of grace and mission through His own initiative.

tekstueel_bewijs: God draws near to them both
God will interrupt the normal progression of things by arriving in—indeed, invading—the midst of human events

object.identificatie: Salvation, New Life, and the 'Fear of the Lord' (Wisdom)
tekstueel_bewijs: the firm ground of their salvation
bringing the gifts of new life

zender.identificatie: God the Father / The Holy One of Israel
tekstueel_bewijs: the God who terrifies is also the one who loves us for all eternity

ontvanger.identificatie: Humanity (Gideon, Peter, the Exile, the Addict, the Hearer)
tekstueel_bewijs: the promises of God break through to the exiles
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is strictly the Receiver of an unmerited gift.

helper.identificatie: The Angel of the Lord / The Holy Spirit / The Word ('Fear Not')
tekstueel_bewijs: the fear is instantly removed by the enabling word 'Fear not'
anoint him with the Holy Spirit
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject who provides His own Helper.
helper.rol_van_geest: External help that creates internal capacity.

tekstueel_bewijs: selfishness, greed, idolatry, cruelty, pettiness, pomposity, vanity, and self-deceit
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is described as a power that would lead to being 'lost' and requires a 'conquering love' to overcome.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human response of following and service (Ethics).
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer (Peter, Gideon)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The 'Fear Not' (Primary) enables the 'Following' (Secondary). The secondary never conditions the primary.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: God → Redemption/New Life → The Sinful Human

voorbeelden_god_subject: God draws near to them both
God will interrupt the normal progression
voorbeelden_mens_subject: they left everything and followed him

voorbeelden: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom (as a state, not a command)
We are trying to turn ourselves around
Gideon perceived that he was the angel of the Lord
has power to make our resistance go up in flames
sphere of power capable of calling into existence the things that do not exist

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on God's 'ability' to save versus man's 'inability'. Grace is the endowment of power to the incompetent.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from Mundane Sin (~S1) to Holy Terror (S2), then through the 'Fear Not' to Grace (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by God taking S2 (Judgment) upon Himself in the Cross to grant S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Very high; S2 is described as 'terror' and 'dread' that is necessary for wisdom.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently places God as the initiator and active subject. Human effort is explicitly sidelined as insufficient.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He does not ask us what we are doing to make ourselves better; he just gives the gift.
God will interrupt... arriving in—indeed, invading—the midst of human events.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Gideon and Peter are not models of virtue to emulate, but examples of human weakness meeting divine power.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: God chooses the weak to show His glory.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and awe; removal of the burden of self-salvation.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation; God does the work.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from OT epiphany to NT Gospel is structurally seamless.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: paying in his own body the price of sin... the Lord has laid on him the iniquity of us all.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is the 'enabling word' that transforms the subject's capacity.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; described as 'rebelliousness' that leads to being 'lost' without intervention.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is powered by Divine invasion. The human actant is correctly positioned as the beneficiary (Receiver) rather than the hero (Subject).

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is a classic grace structure.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in theocentric narrative. It avoids the trap of 'exemplarism' by highlighting the inadequacy of the biblical characters, thereby making God the only possible Subject of the action.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'funny' Gideon story, semiotics reveals that Gideon's 'nonentity' status is a functional requirement for God to be the sole Subject.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Midianites; semiotics explains why the Midianites must be 'smitten as one man' (to show Divine Pouvoir).
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas's model exposes that the 'blanket' metaphor is not just a nice story, but a radical reassignment of the Object (Redemption) to a passive Receiver (the sleeping addict).

appendices.notities: The sermon uses Rutledge's 'Grammar of Grace' effectively by ensuring the 'irruption of grace' is an external action upon the human subject.
